reviews.review_msg: Elizabeth is a wonderful teacher. Organized and skilled. Does a great job of making students feel comfortable with class participation. There were some reading and writing assignments. The art projects she put together were creative and super interesting. She also arranged artists talks and gallery visits so lots of variety in the curriculum.
Elizabeth is very kind and considerate. She is knowledgeable and gives great feedback. She helped me improve my drawing so much. On a side note, Elizabeth is also a really handsome gal :)

Inspiring, wonderful person! Extremely knowledgable in her advice to students. Also, she's a practicing artist herself. Creates a comfortable and safe learning environment open to creative exploration. Lets you redo assignments. Marks assignments fairly based on criteria sheet with techniques covered in class.
She's a wonderful teacher, tho she never really give out clear feedback on grades, but fine arts courses are hard to give out grades until the very end. A great, helpful teacher

She's a pretty amazing and very helpful prof. She will help you develop the artist in you,and provide contemporary examples that will inspire you to shoot higher with your art practice. I definitely recommend you take her. She will challenge you, but you will love her for it. Expect the unexpected out of her, and your artistic capabilities.
Love this woman! She's a newer prof and is doing everything right! Her interest in her students is genuine and I have yet to see her not be available for help. Definitely recommend
